body.p:
Frankfort. May 16th 1861
To His Exc.l B. Magoffin.

The undersigned citizens of the County of Fleming, would respectfully represent that more than Six Twelve months since Henry C Helvestine, a native of the county of Fleming was convicted in the Mason Cir Cout under Indictment charging him with having in his possession counterfeit Bank notes. with intent to utter and pass the same. We would respectfully represent. that while the facts suffecnlly conduced to them that such was the fact. The same facts conclusively Shew that Helvestine, for much of his life had been industrious humble man and of good character, untill he had be debauched. by men of more posetion than himself and being leader in crime used Helvestine through his ignorance as a tool: The facts
are clear that older and far more guilty partys as principals used him Helvestine has a wife and famly of children. very poor. absolutley needing these trying and distressing hardness of the times his aid, We believe that Helvestine is greatly and that the Law has been fully vindicated and that it will be a most judicous and Just exercise of Executive Clemency. to Pardon Said Henry C Helvestine. And that such act will be fully approved by all the people in that section & it will restore him to his famly. and that for the future he will act with more proprety and further we hope he may be the of being to the light and final the Leeder of this conduct in that section

your frnds
L. W. Andrews
H. B. Dobyns
E. Logan
